revised_title: Unconfined Granular Avalanche Flow Along Curved Surfaces: Experiments and Numerical Computations
tldr: This study examines the unconfined flow of granular avalanches along a partly curved surface through experiments and numerical computations. The authors present a new Lagrangian finite difference scheme to solve the governing equations and demonstrate a surprisingly good agreement between experimental results and theoretical predictions. This research contributes to a better understanding of the motion of cohesionless granular materials in real-world situations.
